intro: Miconia alainii, commonly known as the Alain’s miconia, is a tropical shrub native to the island of Moorea in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, violet-pink flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its dispersal by birds and other animals. Miconia alainii is notable for its ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and supporting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
